name: Dark Arbok

attacks.name: Stare
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.) If that Pokémon has a Pokémon Power, that power stops working until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Vapor
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Freezes its prey with its stare. If you should encounter one, remember not to look into its eyes.

strengths: Stare can disable Pokemon Powers - great against Alakazam, Blastoise, etc.
Poison Vapor spreads damage to the entire bench
Can target any opponent Pokemon with Stare
weaknesses: Low HP of 60 for its energy costs
Poison Vapor's base damage is low

competitiveHistory: Dark Arbok was a niche tech card primarily valued for Stare's ability to shut down Pokemon Powers. In a format dominated by Alakazam's Damage Swap and Blastoise's Rain Dance, this disruption was potentially valuable. However, its low HP and damage output limited its competitive viability.

rulings.ruling: Stare's Pokemon Power disruption lasts until the end of your opponent's next turn, not your next turn.
You can target Benched Pokemon with Stare.
Poison Vapor's bench damage ignores Weakness and Resistance as stated.
